item.title: Unsightly weeds growing on public footpath in Ivychurch Close, 21st August
item.description:
It has been reported that weeds need removing all along the blocked paving footpath alongside the grass railing area in Ivychurch Close. The problem has not been fixed. Your workmen have cleared top end of the close today but the weeds all along the brickwalls and blocked paving further along are the ones reported and they have been overlooked. Weeds look unsightly... Please remove these weeds all along the public footpath alongside the brickwalls. Many thanks
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Ivychurch Close, Anerley, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Uneven and rocky paving slabs Willersey avenue, 21st August
item.description:
Uneven and rocky paving slabs between 25-29 Willersey avenue, this has caused someone to fall over already and hurt themselves and they are concerned that if its a child of elderly person it could be a lot worse. Please can this be looked into urgently.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 23, Willersley Avenue, Blackfen, Sidcup, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: No fibre optic cable running to 23a, 21st August
item.description:
I have been living in the property for 3 months and advised virgin media that I was moving a month prior, so I have been waiting for broadband to be installed for 4 months effectively. I am told by Avonline that the request to pull the cable up to my house has been made, but has yet to be approved. Please can this oversight be looked into and rectified so that this service can be enabled for me?
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Sheringham Road, Anerley, London
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Utility Works and Temporary Traffic Lights

item.title: Low trees along river Poole path, 21st August
item.description:
Please see attached photos of the low hanging tree by the river Poole path. I'm only 5ft 6in tall and I have to duck to walk along the path, also this area should be maintained by both Bromley council and First Port management company but it looks very overgrown and neglected.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Montana Gardens, New Beckenham, London

item.title: Littered streets, 21st August
item.description:
All the streets around N18 1HW are littered with litter due to no street cleaners. This includes Gloucester Road, Stirling Way and whole Bull Lane area. There has been no street cleaning in nearly a month.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Gloucester Road, Edmonton, London

item.description:
